title: LibGuides: Health, Medicine & Safety Sources in State Agency Databases: Home
author: Daniel Cornwall
description: LibGuides: Health, Medicine & Safety Sources in State Agency Databases: Home
cleaned_text: Each quarter (Mar, Jun, Oct, Dec) we will use this space to highlight a database we find interesting. The CDC provides a regularly-updated [Influenza-Like Illness (ILI) activity map](http://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/index.htm#ILIActivityMap) and an [interactive, state-specific surveillance tool](https://gis.cdc.gov/grasp/fluview/fluportaldashboard.html) on their [Weekly U.S. Influenza Surveillance Report](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/index.htm). Some other helpful resources from state and local agencies and library associations: The Document Specialists for the states listed below have indicated their state has one or more databases in this subject area. If a state is not listed below it means we do not know of any searchable databases produced by that state government on this subject. If you know of other state-produced databases in this subject, please use the "email me" link in the "Project Coordinator" box at the left to drop us a line. [Return](http://godort.libguides.com/statedatabases) to the main [State Agency Databases Project](http://godort.libguides.com/statedatabases) home page.
